Our goal is to deliver creative solutions to complex problems using our domain expertise, sophisticated technical tools and passion to solve puzzles.

The Department of Defense’s Chief Digital & AI Office (CDAO) is building a strong foundation for data, analytic, and AI-enabled capabilities to be developed and fielded at scale. Redhorse advises the CDAO on developing DoD scale strategies in partnership with the Services, Joint Staff, CCMDs, other DoD components, and mission owners.
Brought to you by GSA and USPS

During the Covid-19 crisis, Redhorse continued its 4-year long support of GSA's USAccess PIV Credentialing with the ideation and creation of a collaborative solution: hosting credentialing sites inside USPS locations, or the USAccess Point Pilot.

Under contract to the US Army Engineering and Support Center, Huntsville, Redhorse provides (REM) services to the Joint Region Marianas (JRM) energy program. Redhorse performs data analytics and modeling on energy and utilities data. We identify and develop energy conservation measures into projects of all types.
b N AL | |n ) i LRl [1111) LA I ; ; % :

The Department of Defense (DoD) recognized the need to close some of its installations and realign DoD missions at others. Redhorse supports the Department of the Navy’s Base Realignment and Closure (BRAC) Program Management Office’s mission in efficiently providing all services necessary to realign, close, and dispose of properties while supporting the warfighter and provide savings to DON and the federal taxpayer.

When to Contact the Service Desk
The Redhorse Service Desk is here for when you need assistance with Redhorse assets or services. .
Contact the Redhorse Service Desk if:
• You are using a Redhorse laptop and experience a technical problem.
• You are having trouble accessing your Redhorse email from a client computer.
• You are unable to log into your Okta account.
Contact the client’s IT support team if:
• You are using a client laptop and experience a technical problem.
• You are having trouble accessing your client email from a Redhorse computer.

DOs • Look at the sender of the email (mouse over) to determine if the address is legitimate
• Review the contents of the email for requests for “urgent action,” account changes/updates, poor English, etc.
• If it looks suspicious but you’re not sure, call the person to find out if they sent it
• If you suspect a phishing attack, immediately send an email ITSecurity@redhorsecorp.com
• Click links contained in emails from untrusted senders
• Give out any PII, CBI, CUI or CDI
• URL’s starting with ‘https://’ are designated as secure

Redhorse’s proactive quality program begins with recruiting the right employees and providing them with the right quality tools to help them succeed in identifying and meeting customer requirements.
Redhorse’s quality program includes activities designed to deliver quality services to our clients and promote continual improvement to the effectiveness of the Quality Management System.

Quality Management System Goal: Have customers that are Redhorse advocates. Performance Objectives:

Redhorse performance objectives for program management support at the corporate level are customer focused and customer driven. When Redhorse achieves these objectives, it has more than “satisfied customers”, we have customers that serve as “advocates.”

Procedures are only effective if each person also takes individual responsibility for their own quality.
It’s your work product, but Redhorse’s reputation!
Every work product produced, or service provided by an individual, impacts the reputation and future success of the entire organization.
If you do not have the time to do it right the first time, when will you find the time to do it over? - John Wooden

Our quality program stresses planning for quality at the very outset of the project work planning process. Invest a small amount of time upfront to avoid the cost and stress of trying to “fix” the project at the end.

Copay Flat dollar amount member is responsible for at the time of service. The plan usually pays 100% of the remaining balance. Deductible Amount member is responsible for before the plan pays for certain services. Coinsurance Percentage of payment shared between the member and the plan for certain services after the deductible has been met. Out-of-Pocket Maximum Member total payments for deductible, coinsurance and copays to stated maximum per plan year. Once reached, the plan will pay 100% for eligible expenses for the rest of the plan year. High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP) Qualified plan as defined by the IRS. No first dollar benefits, all services are subject to the deductible before the plan will pay. Exception is Routine Preventive Care as defined by the IRS. HSA – Health Savings Account Tax Free account that is established by the employee that is covered by a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP). Network Provider Medical and pharmacy providers that have contracted with the plan to provide lower out-of-pocket costs for members.

metadata.text_as_html:
CopayFlat dollar amount member is responsible for at the time of service. The plan usually pays 100% of the remaining balance.
DeductibleAmount member is responsible for before the plan pays for certain services.
CoinsurancePercentage of payment shared between the member and the plan for certain services after the deductible has been met.
Out-of-Pocket MaximumMember total payments for deductible, coinsurance and copays to stated maximum per plan year. Once reached, the plan will pay 100% for eligible expenses for the rest of the plan year.
High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP)Qualified plan as defined by the IRS. No first dollar benefits, all services are subject to the deductible before the plan will pay. Exception is Routine Preventive Care as defined by the IRS.
HSA — Health Savings AccountTax Free account that is established by the employee that is covered by a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP).
Network ProviderMedical and pharmacy providers that have contracted with the plan to provide lower out-of-pocket costs for members.

Health plan contracted with a network of “preferred providers” - DO NOT need PCP or referrals Flexibility to go outside of network and self-refer to specialist
• Stay in-network to experience lower out-of-pocket costs due to contracted rates
• Deductible: the amount that must be satisfied before the insurance plan pays for certain covered services
Must meet your deductible before the plan begins to pay certain benefits Coinsurance is the cost share between you and your insurance provider after deductible is met
• Works in conjunction with a Health Savings Account (HSA)

Ability to set aside pre-tax contributions to cover higher deductible and other qualified expenses. No “use it or lose it!” - Use it now or save it for later; the funds in your HSA remain yours even if you change medical plans, employers, or retire. Make contributions any time after your HSA is open via payroll deductions.
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed or reproduced in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of Redhorse Corporation.
HSAs Fund Health Care Needs The HSA fund can be used for future medical needs and toward the plan’s annual deductible and out-of-pocket maximum.
HSAs are Flexible You decide when to use your HSA funds to pay for qualified health related expenses. The HSA moves with you when you change medical plans, change employers or retire.
HSAs Can Cover You in Retirement Your HSA funds can be used in retirement for eligible health related expenses, including Medicare expenses.
No “use it or lose it!” That’s right, unused funds roll over each year. Unused funds can also grow through interest and investment earnings and can be “banked” for future health related expenses.
Triple Tax-Advantaged (federal & most state taxes) No tax on contributions, accrued interest, or money you withdraw
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed or reproduced in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of Redhorse Corporation.
As an HSA Plan participant, Redhorse Corporation will contribute funds quarterly (first Payroll of January, April, July, and October) into your HSA account for the 2024 plan year
You may also contribute additional pre-tax dollars into your HSA, up to the IRS limits, through convenient payroll deductions or deposits, like you would at any other bank.
HSA Contribution Limits 2024 Employee Only $4,150 Family (employee + 1 more) $8,300 Catch-up Contribution (age 55+) $1,000

hsaban K own your health & wealth™
• HSA Bank is the banking administrator that Cigna partners with to administer funds in your Health Savings Account
• After enrolling in one of the HDHP/HSA medical plans, your information will be sent to HSA Bank and a bank account will automatically be opened for you
The HSA Bank app gives you the tools to take control of your health accounts. Safe and secure, the app offers real-time access for all your account needs, 24/7.
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed or reproduced in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of Redhorse Corporation.
What is a PPO? • PPO: Preferred Provider Organization
─ Health plan contracted with a network of “preferred providers”
─ Do NOT need PCP or referrals
─ Stay inside PPO network for lower copays and full coverage
─ Going outside of the network means higher out-of-pocket costs
covered services ─ Must meet your deductible before the plan begins to pay certain benefits
• Deductible: the amount that must be satisfied before the insurance plan pays for certain
─ Coinsurance is the cost share between you and your insurance provider after deductible is met
─ PPO plans are recommended for anyone who wants the largest choice of providers and the freedom to self-refer to specialists
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed or reproduced in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of Redhorse Corporation.
While we can not recommend a plan for you, some things to consider when selecting your medical plan:

HDHP Traditional PPO Plan Would you rather pay more money as you incur services or pay more each pay period? Least amount of money out of your paycheck – you will pay more when you incur services. Most money out of your paycheck – set copays for many services. Do you take expensive or several prescription drugs? If yes, are you comfortable with paying 100% of the cost up to your deductible then the applicable co- pay up to the OOPM? If yes, the deductible does not apply and there are set copays per prescription type. Are you looking for a tax advantaged savings method? If yes, this plan allows you to set aside money in an HSA that you can use for healthcare expenses or retirement. If yes, this plan does not provide access to any special accounts like an HSA. Are you covering a dependent on the medical coverage? If yes, are you comfortable with the family deductible and OOPM? If yes, this plan has a separate deductible and OOPM per person – it is not on an aggregate basis. Which plan is better? Both are quality plans. It just depends on your financial point of view, medical needs and long term financial goals and objectives. Both plans provide comprehensive coverage and include an out-of-pocket maximum (though the amount varies based on plan selection).

Do you take expensive or several prescription drugs?If yes, are you comfortable with paying 100% of the cost up to your deductible then the applicable co- pay up to the OOPM?If yes, the deductible does not apply and there are set copays per prescription type.
Are you looking for a tax advantaged savings method?If yes, this plan allows you to set aside money in an HSA that you can use for healthcare expenses or retirement.If yes, this plan does not provide access to any special accounts like an HSA.
Are you covering a dependent on the medical coverage?If yes, are you comfortable with the family deductible and OOPM?If yes, this plan has a separate deductible and OOPM per person - it is not on an aggregate basis.
Which plan is better?Both are quality plans. It just depends on your financial point of view, medical needs and long term financial goals and objectives. Both plans provide comprehensive coverage and include an out-of-pocket maximum (though the amount varies based on plan selection).

PREVENTIVE CARE – Covered at 100% on all medical plan options. Know what services are covered at 100% by Cigna Healthcare prior to your preventive care visit
Routine preventive for Children* Appropriate screenings based on gender and age

─ Newborn visits ─ Tuberculosis testing ─ Anemia testing ─ Lead exposure ─ Pelvic exam and pap test ─ Development and behavior ─ Lipid profile ─ Depression ─ Obesity and counseling ─ Nutrition counseling

Routine preventive for Adults Appropriate screenings based on gender and age ─ Lipid profile ─ Diabetes ─ Pelvic exam and pap testing ─ Breast exam and mammogram ─ Bone density testing ─ Colonoscopy ─ Aortic aneurysm

Some of the things you can do with the myCigna App are: • Manage and track claims • •

IRS regulated program allowing employees to pay qualified health care and/or dependent care expenses on a pre-tax basis Decrease your taxable income and increase your take-home pay

W_W (=51 A— o ST @ | = I i)

To enroll for benefits, log into UKG, click on Myself, then Life Events. From there you will be able to select the available Life Event option - “I am a new employee” - to begin the step-by-step election process.

Within the process you will find detailed information about the plans available to you and instructions for enrolling. You can also review additional benefit materials on the Intranet's Wellness page here.

If you are NOT interested in enrolling in medical, dental, vision, or voluntary benefits, you must still complete your profile, go through the enrollment steps, and indicate you are waiving coverage. All benefits must be enrolled or declined. You will be automatically enrolled into the Group Life and Short/Long-Term Disability plans – paid for by Redhorse.

Begins contributing 25; contributes next 15 years . At 40 she
• Begins contributing to the at age 25; contributes $100/month for the next 15 years.
• At age 40 she has to stop contributing to the plan in order to fulfill other obligations.
• Quickly spends his earnings and doesn’t save any money.
• Waits until he get married at age 35 to begin contributing $100/month, then contributes for the next 30 years.
When it comes to saving for Retirement, put TIME on your side.
The longer you participate in the Retirement Plan, the more time you are giving your investments to potentially grow. It’s important to get started now no matter how old you are.
Based on a hypothetical illustration assuming 6% annual rate of return, who has more money at Age 65?
If Ann had the opportunity to keep contributing to the Retirement Plan at the same rate up to Age 65, her hypothetical “End of year Balance” at Age 65 would be $349,101.
Estimate 401(k) Contribution Effects on Your Paycheck

FOR ILLUSTRATIVE PURPOSES ONLY. This hypothetical illustration does not represent the performance of any investment options. It assumes a $30,000 annual salary, 6% annual rate of return and reinvestment of earnings, with no withdrawals. Rates of return may vary. The illustration does not reflect any charges, expenses or fees that may be associated with the Plan.
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed or reproduced in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of Redhorse Corporation.
Prepare for Your Future • Typically, people have relied on three main sources of income in retirement:
─ Social Security ─ Retirement savings through an employer-sponsored plan ─ Personal savings
• Even though this “three-legged stool” is the traditional standard for how people
fund their retirement, it often does not work out that way ─ Many times, people must rely on earnings from a job after they turn 65 - this may be because
they have not saved enough through an employer-sponsored plan or have little to no personal savings
Income Sources for persons age 65 and older
To get an estimate of your Social Security benefits, go to the online Social Security calculator at http://www.ssa.gov/OACT/quickcalc.
USTRATIVE PURPOSES ONLY. Source: Fast Facts & Figures About Social Security, 2014.

hours per pay period • Need to record all hours
worked, even in excess of 80 hours per pay period
Must record all hours worked • Hours over 40 per week (or 8 hours per day in California) must be recorded as overtime
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed or reproduced in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of Redhorse Corporation.
• Must record at least 80 hours - can include Paid Time Off (PTO)
• Can utilize flex time within a pay period—if contract and supervisor allow and is pre-approved
• Must record in and out (start and stop) times and meal/lunch break times
Please review the Timekeeping User Manual available on the Intranet under Documents>Timekeeping & Expense
• Can utilize flex time within a week – if contract and supervisor allow and is pre-approved (not available for California employees)

• Bereavement Leave – 3 days of paid leave for the death of an immediate family member
• Jury Duty – 3 days of paid leave if called to fulfill civic duties
• Sick Pay – accrue 1 hour of sick for every 30 hours worked with a cap of 56 hours per year
• Vacation – eligible employees will accrue up to 15 days of time off to be used for vacation time, personal time, etc.
─ Tiered increases to accrual rates based on years of service
─ Can accrue up to 1.5 x the annual accrual rate
You can view details of the Redhorse Time Off Program on the Company Intranet.

Fill Out Daily • Company and DCAA requirement
• Floor checks performed daily to ensure compliance
• Timesheet audits are conducted and non-compliance reported to reported to Supervisor and Senior Management
Submit Every Pay Period • Timesheets must be submitted by COB every pay period
• Vacation can be recorded in advance. Timesheets should then be submitted when done working for the week: No Exceptions

Payroll • Processed semi-monthly on the 5th and
• Paid Time Off balances available in Costpoint and UKG
• W-2s are available on UKG at the end of year (by January 31 of following year)
• Paycheck calendar is available on the company Intranet
• Changes to payroll related information is made through UKG
